description: From French athlétique and Latin āthlēticus, from Ancient Greek ἀθλητικός (athlētikós, “relating to an athlete”), from ἀθλητής (athlētḗs, “athlete”): equivalent to athlete +‎ -ic. For more, see athlete.

adjectives.description: athletic (comparative more athletic, superlative most athletic)

entries.meaning: (not comparable) Having to do with athletes.
examples: Are you a member of the American Athletic Association?
Since you're such an athletic person, you may wish to consider joining.

entries.meaning: Having a muscular, well developed body, being in shape.
examples: You have such an athletic build—you must work out regularly.

entries.meaning: An attribute of a motion or play which requires fine physical ability.
examples: The center fielder made an athletic play to snatch the ball from over the fence.

entries.meaning: (video games) Of a level in a Super Mario game: with an emphasis on platforming challenge, often involving precise jumps between floating platforms above a bottomless pit, and having upbeat background music.
A muscular, large–boned person, in the typology of Ernst Kretschmer.
